title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

00:15 <Chami1> has left #xwiki

09:25 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki

09:27 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

09:38 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <evalica> has quit  
09:51 <cmarcoin> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <cmarcoin> has left #xwiki  
09:53 <cmarcoin> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vmassol> hi guys  
09:57 <vmassol> sdumitriu: XWIKI-6688  
10:06 <jamesxu> has quit  
10:08 <@cjdelisle> mmm XHS looks so much nicer than it did last I looked, thanks Sergiu  
10:20 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <Chami1> tmortagne: hi  
10:23 <+tmortagne> Chami1: hi  
10:23 <+tmortagne> sent you several mails  
10:24 <Chami1> yeah i saw them  
10:24 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <+tmortagne> you can ignore things like in svn using a .gitignore file at the root of your repository, see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/.gitignore for example  
10:25 <+tmortagne> (for binary files)  
10:26 <Chami1> ok, i'll remove binary files manually  
10:27 <+tmortagne> same for README~  
10:28 <+tmortagne> isn't https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/android-client/blob/master/gen generated during the build too ?  
10:28 <Chami1> currently i'm working on a different pc. I'll remove them when I go home  
10:29 <+tmortagne> who is generating the bin folder ? Eclipse ?  
10:29 <+tmortagne> since maven is supposed to work in a target folder  
10:29 <Chami1> eclipse created bin and gen folders  
10:29 <+tmortagne> how do you import the project in Eclipse ?  
10:30 <+tmortagne> is M2Eclipse able to see it's an android project ?  
10:30 <Chami1> repo should only include res, src folders only  
10:30 <Chami1> we can import as a maven project  
10:30 <+tmortagne> and it's automatically converted to an android project during import ?  
10:31 <StefanM> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <Chami1> if you have installed android-plugin for eclipse i will  
10:32 <Chami1> \*it  
10:32 <+tmortagne> that's cool  
10:32 <+tmortagne> need to setup that  
10:34 <Chami1> building using androd plugin is much easy than using maven  
10:35 <+tmortagne> I guess  
10:35 <+tmortagne> but it's always better to have maven build working for anyone not using Eclipse  
10:35 <+tmortagne> plus it make possible to execute it more easily in hudson/jenkins  
10:35 <j-saturne> has quit  
10:35 <Chami1> yeah  
10:35 <+tmortagne> is it possible to do unit test on android project ?  
10:36 <+tmortagne> when I'm done on my side making it work I will setup jenkins agent to build it automatically  
10:37 <+tmortagne> plus that will automatically deploy the apk on maven.xwiki.org for anyone to test the last build easily  
10:37 <Chami1> here is how to setup eclipse-ADT (android plugin) http://developer.android.com/sdk/eclipse-adt.html  
10:37 <+tmortagne> thanks  
10:38 <+tmortagne> what OS are you working on BTW ?  
10:38 <Chami1> I didn't do any unit test in android. so have to check on that  
10:38 <Chami1> ubuntu  
10:38 <+tmortagne> ok at least if it works for you should be work for me then ;)  
10:39 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <j-saturne> has quit  
10:44 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <+tmortagne> Chami1: I think the minimum requirement should be android 2.1 and not 2.2 since there is still a lot of phones stuck on 2.1  
10:44 <+tmortagne> unless you really need some API existing only in 2.2 and it's ok  
10:45 <+tmortagne> lets 2.1 should be the minimum if not too painful  
10:46 <Chami1> most of the 2.2 are working fine in 2.1  
10:46 <Chami1> ok, i will change target sdk to 2.1  
10:47 <Chami1> ah, forget to tell  
10:47 <Chami1> handling xml is little bit hard and for this one I use json objects  
10:48 <Chami1> shall I continue with json or is it essential to use xml ?  
10:48 <+tmortagne> what do you mean by hard ? reslet does not take care itself of the XML -> Java part ?  
10:48 <+tmortagne> you are not supposed to manipulate XML  
10:49 <+tmortagne> it's not essential to use XML no but I don't understand why you have a problem with XML  
10:52 <Chami1> since I told you I will commit within yesterday i try hard to decode xml  
10:52 <Chami1> but it take time to study it  
10:52 <Chami1> but JSON handling in android is very easy  
10:53 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne, Chami1: http://www.h-online.com/open/news/item/Most-Android-devices-still-running-version-2-2-1254624.html  
10:53 <@sdumitriu> Android 2.1 = 21%  
10:53 <+tmortagne> Chami1: AFAIK there is a bug in the JSON serializer in the version of restlet we are using so XL is safer  
10:54 <+tmortagne> but why is it easier to work with JSON ?  
10:54 <+tmortagne> you have a library in android taking care of JSON -> Java object ?  
10:55 <Chami1> yeah  
10:55 <Chami1> not to java object  
10:55 <+tmortagne> if that so and you don't need restlet ar all then that's great and you should really use JSON  
10:55 <Chami1> it can decode easily  
10:55 <+tmortagne> decode and do what with it ?  
10:56 <+tmortagne> if you plan to code youself what restlet is doing already for XML I don't really see the point unless restlet android lib is very big  
10:57 <StefanM> has quit  
10:57 <Chami1> currently it retrieves list of search results.(only the title)  
10:57 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: thanks, 21% seems big enough as a minimum requirement IMO  
10:57 <Chami1> to do that I decode JSON object  
10:58 <Chami1> agree with you on reslet thing  
10:58 <+tmortagne> checking how big restlet is  
11:01 <+tmortagne> btw if you say JSON is easier that XML it's even possible restlet is using JSON instead of XML  
11:01 <Chami1> :)  
11:01 <+tmortagne> in any case I think what's important is to let others do the painful work ;)  
11:03 <+tmortagne> hmm it's not very light, looks liek they don't separate client and server in separate libraries...  
11:03 <+tmortagne> 650K at least  
11:06 <+tmortagne> bu there is probably lighter to do just the XML <-> JAVA part  
11:07 <+tmortagne> Chami1: http://simple.sourceforge.net/  
11:07 <+tmortagne> looks like it's the JAXB guy in android environment  
11:08 <Chami1> sdumitriu: it's not big deal to change target to 2.1. I'll do  
11:09 <+tmortagne> but does not seems that light either actually  
11:16 <+tmortagne> Chami1: just found http://code.google.com/p/google-gson/  
11:17 <+tmortagne> it's handling JSON <-> Java and it's 14.3 Ko  
11:17 <+tmortagne> best solution I could find for now  
11:18 <Chami1> seems like this is feasible  
11:18 <+tmortagne> and http://benjii.me/2010/04/deserializing-json-in-android-using-gson/  
11:18 <+tmortagne> as a tutorial  
11:21 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
11:21 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
11:23 <Chami1> after we deserialize we have to make java objects according to jaxb model. isn't it?  
11:26 <+tmortagne> yes but google-gson is supposed to unserialize in any java object as they say  
11:27 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <+tmortagne> "Gson can work with arbitrary Java objects including pre-existing objects that you do not have source-code of"  
11:27 <+tmortagne> sounds good  
11:28 <+tmortagne> so you should be able to reuse existing XWiki rest model jar  
11:30 <Chami1> i'll check  
11:31 <Chami1> btw is there any way to remove all github files and add newly to the repo  
11:32 <+tmortagne> Chami1: as I told you in the mail basically you can simply do whatever you want in the filesystem and do a git commit -a since you are the only one committing for now it should be ok  
11:34 <+tmortagne> you don't really need to take care too much to use proper git mv and things like that like it's was absolutely necessary with svn  
11:34 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: right ?  
11:34 <Chami1> doesn't it maintaing subversioning of files  
11:34 <Chami1> ?  
11:35 <+tmortagne> Chami1: as long as you don't modify a file you can move it where you want git is supposed to be able to find it, it's not hierarchical like svn is  
11:36 <+tmortagne> but if you want to be extra carefull you can always use git mv  
11:36 <+tmortagne> in any case didn't you wanted to remove everything ?  
11:38 <Chami1> first I should create a new folder and have to move all files to it  
11:39 <+tmortagne> Chami1: btw you can do that with EGit as I told you  
11:39 <+tmortagne> it will take care of using equivalent of git mv when needed  
11:40 <+tmortagne> just install EGit and "share" your eclipse project  
11:48 <Chami1> i'm afraid of making two copies in each file  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> Git automatically detects file moves, git mv is just a nice way to do mv & git rm & git add  
12:00 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:02 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: seems that XWIKI-5319 is back  
12:03 <+sburjan> but it seems only happens when unsing https  
12:04 <+sburjan> also no proxy is involved. Should I create a new one, or re-open with a comment ?  
12:06 <@sdumitriu> New issue  
12:07 <@sdumitriu> Actually  
12:07 <@sdumitriu> Could be http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-601  
12:08 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: don't know what to say. I am using a tomcat + hsqldb, not jetty  
12:09 <+sburjan> and not using forward or reverse proxy  
12:09 <+sburjan> only https  
12:09 <@sdumitriu> Well, the proxy is just a way to trigger the problem  
12:11 <@sdumitriu> Maybe HTTPS also triggers the problem  
12:12 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that getURL returns a full URL, not just a relative one, and the full links are recognized as wiki links inside the {{html}} macro  
12:12 <@sdumitriu> Anyway, make a new issue, I'll check later what's realy happening  
12:13 <+sburjan> yepp, I'm gonna investigate a little bit. just uninstalled squid and apache httpd to make sure I'm not proxying  
12:30 <abusenius> has quit  
12:33 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: reported.

12:57 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:59 <jvelociter> has quit

13:20 <+sburjan> seems agent 1 is stuck

15:26 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki

15:31 <j-saturne> has quit  
15:37 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:39 <DrLou> has quit  
16:42 <sburjan> has quit  
16:44 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: do you have any idea  what is the "id" field in PropertyClass ?  
16:45 <+tmortagne> hmm looks like it's actually the object id  
16:45 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
16:45 <+tmortagne> don't see why it's there  
16:45 <@sdumitriu> For queries: where obj.id = prop.id.id  
16:46 <@cjdelisle> obj.id = prop.id works as well  
16:46 <+tmortagne> hmm actually I don't see what is object id  
16:46 <+tmortagne> though about number at first but thats not it  
16:46 <@sdumitriu> objectid should be a hash  
16:47 <+tmortagne> like document ids stored in the db ?  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
16:47 <+tmortagne> so with the same issue...  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> Right  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> Even more dire, since there are more objects  
16:47 <@cjdelisle> IIRC objectid is not a hash but a sequence in the db, just a number to use for linking the object to the properties.  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> So hash collisions are more probable  
16:47 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Nope, it's a hash  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> It should be a sequence number, though  
16:48 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: maybe you miw with object guid  
16:48 <+tmortagne> \*mix  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> Or we should switch to GUIDs  
16:48 <+tmortagne> yea it's becoming a mess...  
16:48 <+tmortagne> anyway I don't care about it to merge class properties which is all I wanted to know :)  
16:49 <@cjdelisle> oh I see  
16:49 <@cjdelisle> that is bad  
16:49 <@cjdelisle> GUIDs are slow  
16:55 <@sdumitriu> WDYM slow?  
16:55 <@sdumitriu> Slow to generate?  
16:55 <@sdumitriu> Java only implements random GUIDs, so it's not that costly  
16:57 <@sdumitriu> I have a dilema...  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> I'd like to change the mapping for a field, to switch from 2000 chars to 255, so that it fits in a varchar, and I can create an index on it  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> But Hibernate doesn't alter tables to change the definition of existing columns  
16:58 <@sdumitriu> This means that we'll get a stacktrace in the log when starting a new version on an older database  
16:59 <@cjdelisle> slow to binary search since they're sparse  
16:59 <@sdumitriu> It's not critical, since it's just a log entry, and the only problem is that the index won't be created  
16:59 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: will it make something not working ?  
16:59 <@sdumitriu> But otherwise it works  
16:59 <+tmortagne> is there a simple solution we can provide in the release note to get cleaner db ?  
16:59 <@sdumitriu> So it's a + for the future, on clean installations  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> With a small - for upgrades  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> There is a solution, but it will take some time  
17:00 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I mean what we could tel user to do if he wants  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> Map to a different column, and write a migrator that moves the data between the two columns  
17:00 <+tmortagne> not a solution from us  
17:00 <@sdumitriu> We already did that for the minor edit field, IIRC  
17:00 <+tmortagne> that would be well enough IMO  
17:01 <@sdumitriu> Oh, we could say "execute this ALTER TABLE command on your database"  
17:01 <+tmortagne> as long as it does not generate any fonctional issue  
17:03 <@sdumitriu> I think I'll go the extra mile and do the database migration  
17:05 <@sdumitriu> I also want to do some more migration on the activitystream data to fix XE-760  
17:05 <j-saturne1> has quit  
17:07 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
17:38 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:41 <evalica1> has quit  
17:42 <+mflorea> guys, why is CI agent-2 running tests? it's a pain to wait 2h for a build..  
17:50 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
17:55 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:55 <vmassol> sorry didn't notice I was offline  
17:55 <vmassol> guys why are there lots of jobs stopped on jenkins?  
17:57 <vmassol> anyone looking at failing tests from http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/740/testReport/ ?  
17:57 <vmassol> (that's the latest run for the tests on matser)  
17:57 <vmassol> note that I just fixed one of those  
17:57 <vmassol> cjdelisle: storage still has one failing  
17:57 <vmassol> anyone looked at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/740/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageFromTemplate/ ?  
17:59 <vmassol> mflorea: you have committed when there was a fialing test!  
18:00 <+mflorea> I fixed a bug  
18:01 <vmassol> and? :)  
18:01 <+mflorea> it wasn't fun :)  
18:02 <vmassol> is that mitigating?  
18:02 <+mflorea> trying :)  
18:02 <vmassol> it's ok if you look at it now :)  
18:02 <abusenius> has quit  
18:03 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
18:03 <vmassol> you're not the only one not looking but the other ones were waiting for you to commit  
18:03 <vmassol> to not get caught  
18:03 <vmassol> that's naughty guys  
18:03 <vmassol> :)  
18:09 <j-saturne> has quit  
18:12 <vmassol> do we want to have a "build monitor/handler" who's responsible to get tests fixed (either by fixing himself or having others fix them). That person would be changed every week. ? WDYT?  
18:12 <@sdumitriu> +1  
18:14 <+mflorea> +1, could be per release cycle  
18:14 <+mflorea> like we have a release manager  
18:14 <+mflorea> we can have a test manager  
18:18 <vmassol> I think it's larger than test, it should be about build  
18:18 <vmassol> now  
18:18 <vmassol> s/now//  
18:18 <+mflorea> yes, a build manager  
18:19 <vmassol> "build fireman"  
18:19 <vmassol> or build manager if you prefer  
18:20 <vmassol> that build fireman would have the right to track who caused the build to fail and ask that person to fix it and that person shouldn't be able to refuse  
18:21 <vmassol> ok I'm taking this week to get it started  
18:21 <vmassol> I'll send a mail too  
18:21 <vmassol> (proposal mail)  
18:22 <vmassol> so anyone knows why we have lots of jobs that were stopped?  
18:22 <vmassol> grey bullets on http://ci.xwiki.org/  
18:22 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Did you stop the jobs to free agent2?  
18:22 <+mflorea> yes  
18:23 <+mflorea> well  
18:23 <+mflorea> both agents were stuck for 10h+  
18:23 <vmassol> what was the error?  
18:23 <+mflorea> so I stopped those jobs  
18:23 <vmassol> there are 8 jobs that were stopped in the last builds  
18:24 <+mflorea> I didn't stopped that many jobs  
18:24 <+mflorea> I think I stopped 4, all were tests  
18:25 <+mflorea> but I haven't checked the error  
18:35 <vmassol> mflorea: my bad, I know know how to read the latest builds gadget  
18:35 <vmassol> you have to look at the Build column and not the jobs one  
18:35 <vmassol> got to take my train  
18:36 <vmassol> would be good if someone can fix http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/740/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.test.ui/CreatePageTest/testCreatePageFromTemplate/
